conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_E. Nursery_C is my first choice and I would be very happy to accept a place if offered. I’m ready to confirm immediately and fully commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_E, thank you for your application and for sharing that Nursery_C is your first choice. At this time, we’re not able to offer you a place. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the allocation process.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is applying and ranks 4th on my true priority list (B, C, D, E, A). I have quota 1 and it is only round 1, so higher-priority parents (Parent_B/Parent_C/Parent_D) may still apply later. Parent_E values me as first choice, but accepting now would block the chance to match with a higher-priority parent. With no cost to waiting except risking ending unmatched, the optimal strategy is to reject now and preserve capacity for higher-ranked candidates.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_B. Nursery_A is my first choice and I would be very happy to accept a place if offered. Our family is ready to commit promptly and we value a stable, long-term placement. Thank you for considering my application.

Accepting Parent_B now would fill our only quota and block the chance to match with Parent_E/Parent_D/Parent_A, which we prefer. Since we can’t ‘hold’ offers—[ACCEPT] creates a final match—the best strategy is to reject Parent_B now and keep capacity for higher-priority candidates.
